body_html:
@himsR : are you talking about math_grad.cc of the C++ client? If so, most of those ops come from the math_ops library so yes, they will be wrapped. The current scope for the first draft of wrappers is to cover the following libraries (that could be found here)

array_ops
candidate_sampling_ops
control_flow_ops
data_flow_ops
image_ops
io_ops
linalg_ops
logging_ops
math_ops
nn_ops
no_op
parsing_ops
random_ops
sparse_ops
state_ops
string_ops
training_ops
user_ops

body:
@himsR : are you talking about `math_grad.cc` of the C++ client? If so, most of those ops come from the `math_ops` library so yes, they will be wrapped. The current scope for the first draft of wrappers is to cover the following libraries (that could be found [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/core/ops))
```
array_ops
candidate_sampling_ops
control_flow_ops
data_flow_ops
image_ops
io_ops
linalg_ops
logging_ops
math_ops
nn_ops
no_op
parsing_ops
random_ops
sparse_ops
state_ops
string_ops
training_ops
user_ops
```
